original: Tasseva arūpāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākaṁ sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ
analyzed: tassa iva arūpāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa kata ttā upacita ttā vipākam sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatana
translated: As a result of having done & accumulated wholesome kamma in the formless world,

original: samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññāsahagataṁ sukhassa ca pahānā …pe… catutthaṁ🔽jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati, tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā
analyzed: samatikkamma nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttha  jhānam upasampajja viharati tasmin samaye saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa viññāṇa paccayā
translated: on the cessation of perception and the cessation of not-perception, neither-perception-nor-non-perception, he dwells having attained the fourth jhāna, which is neither with perception nor without perception,🔽at that time with volitions as condition there is consciousness, with consciousness as condition

original: nāmaṁ, nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatanaṁ, chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā,
analyzed: nāma nāma paccayā chaṭṭhāyatana chaṭṭhāyatana paccayā phassaḥ phassa paccayā vedanā
translated: there is mind, with mind as condition there is the sixth sense sphere, with the sixth sense sphere as condition there is contact, with contact as condition there is feeling,

original: vedanāpaccayā pasādo, pasādapaccayā adhimokkho, adhimokkhapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā
analyzed: vedanā paccayā pasādaḥ pasāda paccayā adhimokkhaḥ adhimokkha paccayā bhavaḥ bhava paccayā
translated: with feeling as condition there is faith, with faith as condition there is resolve, with resolve as condition there is continuation, with continuation as condition

analyzed: jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: there is birth, with birth as condition there is ageing and death.

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: So there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.
.... Supramundane Resultant Consciousness

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are indeterminate dhammas?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ pahānāya
analyzed: yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatānam pahānāya
translated: When one develops the supramundane jhāna, which leads out, which goes to decrease (attachment), to the surmounting of conceit, to the destruction of suffering,

analyzed: paṭhamāya bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati

translated: When he develops the first absorption … with difficulty and slowly in insight, at that time there is contact … and so on as in §10 …🔽These are wholesome thoughts.🔽As a result of developing and repeatedly practicing that noble, supramundane concentration, he experiences a pleasant abiding here and now that is superior to it.🔽When he develops the first absorption … with difficulty and slowly in insight, at that time🔽because of formations there is consciousness, because of consciousness there is mind, because of mind there is the sixth sense sphere, because of the sixth sense sphere🔽there is contact, because of contact there is feeling, because of feeling there is faith, because of faith there is resolve, because of resolve🔽

translated: At whatever time unwholesome kamma has been done and accumulated, and because of that, eye-consciousness has arisen, accompanied by equanimity, with a form as object …🔽ear-consciousness has arisen, accompanied by equanimity, with a sound as object …🔽nose-consciousness has arisen, accompanied by equanimity, with an odour as object …

original: jivhāviññāṇaṁ uppannaṁ hoti upekkhāsahagataṁ rasārammaṇaṁ …pe…🔽kāyaviññāṇaṁ uppannaṁ hoti dukkhasahagataṁ phoṭṭhabbārammaṇaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhārapaccayā🔽viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmaṁ, nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatanaṁ, chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā🔽phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ.

translated: tongue-consciousness has arisen, accompanied by equanimity, with a flavour as object …

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: body-consciousness has arisen, accompanied by pain, with a tangible as object, at that time with formations as condition there is consciousness, with consciousness as condition: mind, with mind as condition: the sixth sense sphere, with the sixth sense sphere as condition: contact, with contact as condition: feeling, with feeling as condition: craving, with craving as condition: attachment, with attachment as condition: continuation, with continuation as condition: birth, with birth as condition: ageing, death, and so there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.

analyzed: tattha katamaḥ saṅkhāro

analyzed: yā cetanā sañcetanā sañcetayitatta

analyzed: ayam vuccati saṅkhāro

analyzed: tattha katamam saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa

analyzed: yam cittam manaḥ mānasam pe  tajjā kāya viññāṇa dhātu

analyzed: idam vuccati saṅkhāra paccayāḥ viññāṇa pe
translated: this is called “with a (volitional) process as condition: consciousness.” …

analyzed: ayam vuccati chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā phasso

analyzed: tattha katamā phassa paccayā vedanā

original: Yaṁ kāyikaṁ asātaṁ kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ kāyasamphassajaṁ asātaṁ dukkhaṁ vedayitaṁ kāyasamphassajā asātā dukkhā vedanā—
analyzed: yam kāyikam asātam kāyikam dukkham kāya samphassa jam asātam dukkham vedayitam kāya samphassa jā asātā dukkhā vedanā

analyzed: ayam vuccati phassa paccayā vedanā

analyzed: tattha katamaḥ vedanā paccayā bhavo

analyzed: ṭhapetvā vedana saññā kkhandho saṅkhāra kkhandho viññāṇa kkhandho

analyzed: ayam vuccati vedanā paccayāḥ bhavaḥ pe
translated: this is called “with feeling as condition: continuation.” …

analyzed: upekkhā sahagatā rūpa ārammaṇā vā sadda ārammaṇā vā gandha ārammaṇā vā rasa ārammaṇā vā phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇā
translated: has tangible as its object …

original: vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā
analyzed: vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa viññāṇa paccayā
translated: or whatever it has as object, on that occasion there is: a causal relation between volitional formations and consciousness,🔽a causal relation between consciousness and name-and-form,

original: nāmaṁ, nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatanaṁ, chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā,
analyzed: nāma nāma paccayā chaṭṭhāyatana chaṭṭhāyatana paccayā phassaḥ phassa paccayā vedanā
translated: a causal relation between name-and-form and the six sense bases, a causal relation between the six sense bases and contact, a causal relation between contact and feeling,

analyzed: vedanā paccayā adhimokkhaḥ adhimokkha paccayā bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: a causal relation between feeling and craving, a causal relation between craving and clinging, a causal relation between clinging and existence, a causal relation between existence and birth, a causal relation between birth and ageing, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: So there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.

analyzed: tattha katamaḥ saṅkhāro

analyzed: ayam vuccati saṅkhāro

analyzed: tattha katamam saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa  yam cittam manaḥ mānasam pe
translated: Herein, what is the causal relation between volitional formations and consciousness?🔽That cognizance, that cognizance aggregate,

analyzed: tad jā manaḥ dhātu
translated: that mind element,

analyzed: idam vuccati saṅkhāra paccayāḥ viññāṇa pe
translated: This is said to be ‘with volitions as condition: consciousness.’ …

analyzed: ayam vuccati chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā phasso
translated: This is said to be ‘with the six sense spheres as condition: contact.’

analyzed: tattha katamā phassa paccayā vedanā

original: Yaṁ cetasikaṁ neva sātaṁ nāsātaṁ cetosamphassajaṁ adukkhamasukhaṁ vedayitaṁ cetosamphassajā adukkhamasukhā vedanā—
analyzed: yam cetasikam na iva sātam na asātam cetaḥ samphassa jam adukkham asukham vedayitam cetaḥ samphassa jā adukkham asukhā vedanā
translated: Whatever is mental, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, born of mind-contact, felt by mind, feeling born of mind-contact, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling—

analyzed: ayam vuccati phassa paccayā vedanā
translated: this is said to be ‘with contact as condition: feeling.’

analyzed: tattha katamaḥ vedanā paccayā adhimokkho
translated: Herein, what is ‘with feeling as condition: resolve?’

analyzed: yaḥ cittassa adhimokkhaḥ adhimuccanā tad adhimutta tā
translated: Whatever is the resolve, the resolvedness, the state of being resolved in the mind—

analyzed: ayam vuccati vedanā paccayā adhimokkho

analyzed: tattha katamaḥ adhimokkha paccayā bhavo
translated: Herein, what is ‘with resolve as condition: continuation?’

analyzed: ṭhapetvā adhimokkha vedanā kkhandho saññā kkhandho saṅkhāra kkhandho viññāṇa kkhandho
translated: Except for resolve, the feeling constituent, perception constituent, volitions constituent, consciousness constituent—

analyzed: ayam vuccati adhimokkha paccayā bhavo pe
translated: this is said to be ‘with resolve as condition: continuation.’ …

original: tena vuccati “evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hotī”ti.
analyzed: tena vuccati evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti iti

analyzed: upekkhā santi īraṇa citta

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are indeterminate things?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākā manoviññāṇadhātu uppannā hoti upekkhāsahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…🔽dhammārammaṇā vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā🔽nāmaṁ, nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatanaṁ, chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā,🔽vedanāpaccayā adhimokkho, adhimokkhapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: yasmin samaye akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu uppannā hoti upekkhā sahagatā rūpa ārammaṇā vā pe dhamma ārammaṇā vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa viññāṇa paccayā  nāma nāma paccayā chaṭṭhāyatana chaṭṭhāyatana paccayā phassaḥ phassa paccayā vedanā  vedanā paccayā adhimokkhaḥ adhimokkha paccayā bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: “On whatever occasion an unwholesome mind element has arisen that is accompanied by equanimity and has form as its object …🔽has a mental phenomenon as its object, or has whatever as its object, on that occasion there is:🔽kamma-resultant mind element,🔽kamma-resultant mind-consciousness element,🔽kamma-resultant mind contact,🔽kamma-resultant equanimity,🔽kamma-resultant intention,🔽kamma-resultant thinking,🔽kamma-resultant applied thought,🔽kamma-resultant sustained thought,🔽kamma-resultant faith,🔽kamma-resultant energy,🔽kamma-resultant mindfulness,🔽kamma-resultant concentration,🔽kamma-resultant wisdom,🔽kamma-resultant calm,🔽kamma-resultant effort,🔽kamma-resultant imperturbability,🔽kamma-resultant mindfulness,🔽kamma-resultant equanimity,🔽kamma-resultant bodily pleasure,🔽kamma-resultant bodily pain,🔽kamma-resultant bodily satisfaction,🔽kamma-resultant bodily dissatisfaction,🔽kamma-resultant bodily composure,🔽kamma-resultant life,🔽kamma-resultant bodily intimation,🔽kamma-resultant verbal intimation,🔽kamma-resultant intention,🔽kamma-resultant attention.🔽On that occasion there is a cause, there is a condition, for the arising of the kamma-resultant mind element.

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: At whatever time unwholesome deeds have been done and accumulated, and because of that the mind-consciousness element has arisen with equanimity as its object, or whatever is the mind-consciousness element that has arisen with a form as object, with a sound as object, with an idea as object, or with whatever it has arisen with as its object, at that time: with volitions as condition there is consciousness, with consciousness as condition: mind, with mind as condition: the sixth sense sphere, with the sixth sense sphere as condition: contact, with contact as condition: feeling, with feeling as condition: resolve, with resolve as condition: continuation, with continuation as condition: birth, with birth as condition: ageing, death, and so there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.

analyzed: tattha katamaḥ saṅkhāro
translated: Herein, what is volition?

analyzed: yā cetanā sañcetanā sañcetayitatta
translated: That volition, the state of having willed, the state of being about to will,

analyzed: ayam vuccati saṅkhāro
translated: this is said to be “volitions”.

analyzed: tattha katamam saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa
translated: Herein, what is “with volitions as condition: consciousness”?

analyzed: yam cittam manaḥ mānasam pe tajjā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu
translated: That mind, that mentality, that consciousness, that thought, that heart, that core of being, that which is of the nature to whirl around, that which is of the nature to cook , that which is of the nature to be confused, that which is of the nature to burn, that which is of the nature to be heated up, that mind-consciousness element,

analyzed: idam vuccati saṅkhāra paccayāḥ viññāṇa pe
translated: this is said to be “with volitions as condition: consciousness”. …🔽Herein, what is “with consciousness as condition: mind”?

original: tena vuccati “evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hotī”ti.🔽2.11.3. 2.11.3 Kiriyācitta
analyzed: tena vuccati evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti iti
translated: that is why it is said: ‘This is how there is an origin of this whole mass of suffering.’🔽… Functioning mind-element
… Functioning mind-element without root-cause

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are indeterminate dhammas?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye manodhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā neva kusalā nākusalā na ca kammavipākā upekkhāsahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…
analyzed: yasmin samaye manaḥ dhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā na iva kusalā na akusalā na ca kamma vipākāḥ upekkhā sahagatāḥ rūpa ārammaṇāḥ vā pe
translated: When the mind element has arisen that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome nor the result of (previous) wholesome or unwholesome (action), but is the result of (previous) heedfulness, and is accompanied by equanimity, and has form as its object …🔽or has sound as its object …

analyzed: phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇāḥ vā pe
translated: or has tangible object as its object …

original: manoviññāṇadhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā neva kusalā nākusalā na ca kammavipākā somanassasahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…

original: Yasmiṁ samaye kāmāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākaṁ cakkhuviññāṇaṁ🔽uppannaṁ hoti upekkhāsahagataṁ rūpārammaṇaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye kusalamūlapaccayā saṅkhāro,🔽saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmaṁ, nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatanaṁ, chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā🔽phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ.

translated: At whatever time he develops the path to rebirth in the form worlds, and at that time associated with equanimity there arises in him knowledge and vision of things as they really are,🔽at that time there is the faculty of concentration, there is the faculty of equanimity, there is the faculty of mind, there is the faculty of mental pleasant feeling, there is the faculty of vitality.🔽At whatever time he develops the path to rebirth in the formless worlds, and at that time associated with equanimity there arises in him knowledge and vision of things as they really are,🔽at that time there is the faculty of concentration, there is the faculty of equanimity, there is the faculty of mind, there is the faculty of mental neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, there is the faculty of vitality.

analyzed: bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: grasping. Conditioned by grasping, continuation. Conditioned by continuation, birth. Conditioned by birth, old age, death,

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: In this way there is a conditioned origination of this whole great mass of suffering.

analyzed: rūpāvacara vipāka citta
translated: … Resultant mind element in the fine-material sphere

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are indeterminate dhammas?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye rūpūpapattiyā maggaṁ bhāveti vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati pathavīkasiṇaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti—
analyzed: yasmin samaye rūpa upapattiyā maggam bhāveti vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti
translated: When one develops the path to rebirth in the form worlds, quite secluded from sense desires … he enters and dwells in the first jhāna … the earth kasiṇa … at that time contact exists … non-distraction exists …

original: ime dhammā kusalā.🔽Tasseva rūpāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākaṁ vivicceva kāmehi
analyzed: ime dhammā kusalā  tassa iva rūpāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa kata ttā upacita ttā vipākam vivicca iva kāmehi
translated: these things are wholesome.🔽Because of having done and accumulated wholesome deeds in the form realm,

original: …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati pathavīkasiṇaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye kusalamūlapaccayā
analyzed: pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati tasmin samaye kusala mūla paccayā
translated: … he attains and remains in the first jhāna, which is without joy and consists of equanimity and unification of mind, based on the earth kasiṇa. At that time, with a wholesome root as condition there is a volitional formation,

original: saṅkhāro, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmaṁ, nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatanaṁ,
analyzed: saṅkhāro saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa viññāṇa paccayā nāma nāma paccayā chaṭṭha āyatana
translated: with a volitional formation as condition: consciousness, with consciousness as condition: mind, with mind as condition: the sixth sense sphere,

original: chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā pasādo, pasādapaccayā
analyzed: chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā phasso phassa paccayā vedanā vedanā paccayā pasādo pasāda paccayā
translated: with the sixth sense sphere as condition: contact, with contact as condition: feeling, with feeling as condition: faith,

original: adhimokkho, adhimokkhapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: adhimokkhaḥ adhimokkha paccayā bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: with faith as condition: resolve, with resolve as condition: continuation, with continuation as condition: birth, with birth as condition: ageing, death.

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: Thus there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.

analyzed: arūpa avacara vipāka citta
translated: … Resultant mind element in the formless (realms)

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are indeterminate things?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye arūpūpapattiyā maggaṁ bhāveti sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma
analyzed: yasmin samaye arūpa upapattiyā maggam bhāveti sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma
translated: When one, for the purpose of rebirth in the formless (realms), develops the path and (attains) the fourth jhāna, which is neither painful nor pleasant and consists of purity of mindfulness by equanimity, having completely transcended the sphere of nothingness,

original: nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññāsahagataṁ sukhassa ca pahānā …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja

analyzed: viharati tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti
translated: at that time contact exists … non-distraction exists …

analyzed: ime dhammā kusalā
translated: These are wholesome thoughts.

analyzed: tassa iva arūpāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa kata ttā upacita ttā vipākam sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatana  samatikkamma nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttha  jhānam upasampajja viharati tasmin samaye kusala mūla paccayā saṅkhāro saṅkhāra paccayā  viññāṇa viññāṇa paccayā nāma nāma paccayā chaṭṭhāyatana chaṭṭhāyatana paccayā  phassaḥ phassa paccayā vedanā vedanā paccayā pasādaḥ pasāda paccayā adhimokkhaḥ adhimokkha paccayā
translated: Because of having done and accumulated wholesome wholesome thoughts in the formless realm,🔽he surmounts the base of nothingness entirely, and enters and emerges from the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

analyzed: bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: At that time, with a wholesome thought as condition there is a formation, with a formation as condition: consciousness, with consciousness as condition: mind, with mind as condition: the sixth sense sphere, with the sixth sense sphere as condition: contact, with contact as condition: feeling, with feeling as condition: faith, with faith as condition: resolve, with resolve as condition: continuation, with continuation as condition: birth, with birth as condition: old age, death,

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: This is how there is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.
… Supramundane Resultant Consciousness

original: Katame dhammā abyākatā?🔽Yasmiṁ samaye lokuttaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti niyyānikaṁ apacayagāmiṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ pahānāya
analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā  yasmin samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatānam pahānāya

original: Tasseva lokuttarassa kusalassa jhānassa katattā bhāvitattā vipākaṁ vivicceva kāmehi

analyzed: pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiññam suññata

analyzed: evam etesam dhammānam samudayaḥ hoti  kusala mūlaka vipāka niddeso

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa citta

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā  yasmin samaye akusalassa kammassa kata ttā upacita ttā vipākam cakkhu viññāṇam uppanna  hoti upekkhā sahagatam rūpa ārammaṇa tasmin samaye akusala mūla paccayā saṅkhāro saṅkhāra paccayā

analyzed: ayam vuccati adhimokkha paccayā bhavo
translated: this is said to be ‘with attachment as condition: continuation’.

analyzed: tattha katamā bhava paccayā jāti
translated: Herein, what is ‘with continuation as condition: birth’?

original: Yā tesaṁ tesaṁ dhammānaṁ jāti sañjāti nibbatti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo—
analyzed: yā tesam tesam dhammānam jāti sañjāti nibbatti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ
translated: Whatever birth, being born, appearing, arising, turning up, manifestation of the group of constituents (of mind and body),

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhava paccayā jāti
translated: this is said to be ‘with continuation as condition: birth’.

analyzed: tattha katamam jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: Herein, what is ‘with birth as condition: old age, death’?

analyzed: atthi jarā atthi maraṇa
translated: There is old age, there is death.

analyzed: tattha katamā jarā
translated: Herein, what is old age?

original: Yā tesaṁ tesaṁ dhammānaṁ jarā jīraṇatā āyuno saṁhāni—
analyzed: yā tesam tesam dhammānam jarā jīraṇa tā āyuno
translated: Whatever in those (beings) is old age, agedness, broken teeth, greying hair, wrinkled skin, slackened sinews, dwindling of the life-force, decay of the sense faculties,

analyzed: ayam vuccati jarā
translated: this is said to be ‘old age’.

analyzed: tattha katamam
translated: Herein, what is death?

original: Yo tesaṁ tesaṁ dhammānaṁ khayo vayo bhedo paribhedo aniccatā antaradhānaṁ—
analyzed: yaḥ tesam tesam dhammānam khayaḥ vayaḥ bhedaḥ paribhedaḥ anicca tā
translated: Whatever in those (beings) is falling away, passing away, breaking up, disappearance, dying, completion of time, dissolution of the constituents (of mind and body), breaking up of the aggregates (of mind and body),

analyzed: idam vuccati maraṇa
translated: this is said to be ‘death’.

analyzed: iti ayam ca jarā idam ca maraṇa
translated: Thus this is old age, and this is death.

analyzed: idam vuccati jāti paccayāḥ jarā maraṇa
translated: This is said to be ‘with birth as condition: old age, death’.

original: Evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hotīti.🔽Evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa saṅgati hoti, samāgamo hoti, samodhānaṁ hoti, pātubhāvo hoti.
analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti iti  evam etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa saṅgati hoti samāgamaḥ hoti samodhānam hoti pātubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: This is how there is an origin of this whole mass of suffering.🔽This is how there comes to be the meeting, the coming together, the association of this whole mass of suffering.

original: Tena vuccati “evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hotī”ti.
analyzed: tena vuccati evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti iti
translated: This is why it was said: ‘This is how there is an origin of this whole mass of suffering.’

analyzed: akusala mūlaka vipāka niddeso
translated: The description of the result of the unwholesome.

analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya
translated: The Abhidhamma Compendium.

analyzed: paṭiccasamuppāda vibhaṅgaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The analysis of dependent origination is finished.
